trans-unit.source: This guide teaches you to perform common scenarios using the latest [JavaScript SDK for Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: This guide teaches you to perform common scenarios using the latest [JavaScript SDK for Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: If you are new to Azure Mobile
trans-unit.target: If you are new to Azure Mobile

trans-unit.source: Apps, first complete [Azure Mobile Apps Quick Start] to create a backend and create a table.
trans-unit.target: Apps, first complete [Azure Mobile Apps Quick Start] to create a backend and create a table.

trans-unit.source: In this guide, we focus on using the mobile
trans-unit.target: In this guide, we focus on using the mobile

trans-unit.source: backend in HTML/JavaScript Web applications.
trans-unit.target: backend in HTML/JavaScript Web applications.

trans-unit.source: Setup and Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Setup and Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes that you have created a backend with a table.
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes that you have created a backend with a table.

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes that the table has the same schema as the tables in those
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes that the table has the same schema as the tables in those

trans-unit.source: tutorials.
trans-unit.target: tutorials.

trans-unit.source: Installing the Azure Mobile Apps JavaScript SDK can be done via the `npm` command:
trans-unit.target: Installing the Azure Mobile Apps JavaScript SDK can be done via the `npm` command:

trans-unit.source: Once installed, the library is located in `node_modules/azure-mobile-apps-client/dist/MobileServices.Web.min.js`.
trans-unit.target: Once installed, the library is located in `node_modules/azure-mobile-apps-client/dist/MobileServices.Web.min.js`.

trans-unit.source: Copy this file to your web area.
trans-unit.target: Copy this file to your web area.

trans-unit.source: The library can also be used as an ES2015 module, within CommonJS environments such as Browserify and
trans-unit.target: The library can also be used as an ES2015 module, within CommonJS environments such as Browserify and

trans-unit.source: Webpack and as an AMD library.
trans-unit.target: Webpack and as an AMD library.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: How to: Authenticate Users
trans-unit.target: How to: Authenticate Users

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service supports authenticating and authorizing app users using a variety of external identity
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service supports authenticating and authorizing app users using a variety of external identity

trans-unit.source: providers: Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter.
trans-unit.target: providers: Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter.

trans-unit.source: You can set permissions on tables to restrict
trans-unit.target: You can set permissions on tables to restrict

trans-unit.source: access for specific operations to only authenticated users.
trans-unit.target: access for specific operations to only authenticated users.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the identity of authenticated
trans-unit.target: You can also use the identity of authenticated

trans-unit.source: users to implement authorization rules in server scripts.
trans-unit.target: users to implement authorization rules in server scripts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Get started with authentication] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Get started with authentication] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Two authentication flows are supported: a server flow and a client flow.
trans-unit.target: Two authentication flows are supported: a server flow and a client flow.

trans-unit.source: The server flow provides the simplest
trans-unit.target: The server flow provides the simplest

trans-unit.source: authentication experience, as it relies on the provider's web authentication interface.
trans-unit.target: authentication experience, as it relies on the provider's web authentication interface.

trans-unit.source: The client flow allows for
trans-unit.target: The client flow allows for

trans-unit.source: deeper integration with device-specific capabilities such as single-sign-on as it relies on provider-specific SDKs.
trans-unit.target: deeper integration with device-specific capabilities such as single-sign-on as it relies on provider-specific SDKs.

trans-unit.source: How to: Register for Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: How to: Register for Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Install the [phonegap-plugin-push] to handle push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Install the [phonegap-plugin-push] to handle push notifications.

trans-unit.source: This can be easily added using the `cordova plugin add`
trans-unit.target: This can be easily added using the `cordova plugin add`

trans-unit.source: command on the command line, or via the Git plugin installer within Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: command on the command line, or via the Git plugin installer within Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: The following code in your Apache
trans-unit.target: The following code in your Apache

trans-unit.source: Cordova app will register your device for push notifications:
trans-unit.target: Cordova app will register your device for push notifications:

trans-unit.source: Use the Notification Hubs SDK to send push notifications from the server.
trans-unit.target: Use the Notification Hubs SDK to send push notifications from the server.

trans-unit.source: You should never
trans-unit.target: You should never

trans-unit.source: send push notifications directly from clients as that could be used to trigger a denial of
trans-unit.target: send push notifications directly from clients as that could be used to trigger a denial of

trans-unit.source: service attack against Notification Hubs or the PNS.
trans-unit.target: service attack against Notification Hubs or the PNS.
